response.original_title: First and Lastː Casualties of the Great War
response.overview: The tragic story of the Great War is told through the accounts of the British and Canadian soldiers who were the first and last to die in battle. In Mons, Belgium during World War I, Private John Parr, aged 17, from Middlesex, England, was the first Allied soldier to die. Four years later, Private George Price, aged 25, from Nova Scotia, would be the last. Although the two men never met, the circumstances of their deaths linked their lives. FIRST AND LAST attempts to reveal the details of their lives while helping us better understand World War I.
response.title: First and Lastː Casualties of the Great War
